decks.notes: The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Wasteland, Force of Will, and Daze while maintaining a fast pace with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler. The deck also utilizes card advantage and selection through powerful cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder, as well as Gitaxian Probe. Additionally, the inclusion of disruptive spells like Cabal Therapy and countermagic like Spell Pierce adds another layer of control to the aggressive strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, hand disruption, and card advantage. The deck includes versatile cards like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to provide additional value and flexibility. The mana base allows for a variety of colored spells to be cast efficiently. The creatures in the deck also provide value by drawing cards, gaining life, and disrupting the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outcontrol the opponent to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's mana base while putting pressure on them with efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler. The deck aims to control the game through disruption spells like Wasteland and Daze, while also maintaining card advantage and selection with cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful disruptive creatures like Deathrite Shaman and True-Name Nemesis helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while closing out games quickly.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of powerful spells and card advantage. The deck utilizes a variety of control elements, such as counterspells (Force of Will), removal (Fatal Push, Lightning Bolt), discard (Hymn to Tourach, Inquisition of Kozilek, Thoughtseize), and planeswalker control (Jace, the Mind Sculptor). It also incorporates card draw (Brainstorm, Preordain) and graveyard interaction (Deathrite Shaman, Snapcaster Mage) to maintain consistency and efficiency. The mana base is carefully crafted to allow for flexibility and access to a wide range of spells.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing lands effectively. It features a mix of utility lands, such as Wasteland and Maze of Ith, as well as key combo pieces like Thespian's Stage and Dark Depths. The deck also utilizes cards like Ghost Quarter and Punishing Fire to disrupt opponents' strategies and maintain control. Additionally, it has the ability to quickly ramp up its mana with cards like Mox Diamond and Exploration, allowing for efficient and powerful plays. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to control the game through the manipulation and utilization of lands.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Force of Will, Counterspell, Swords to Plowshares, and Terminus, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its win conditions with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck also utilizes card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency and efficiency in its control strategy. Additionally, the inclusion of Search for Azcanta and Entreat the Angels provides additional utility and win conditions.

The deck aims to quickly bring out powerful creatures such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand by using the card Show and Tell, while also utilizing Sneak Attack as an alternative strategy. The deck contains numerous card draw and card selection spells to ensure consistency, as well as disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo. The deck also includes fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide to power out the combo pieces ahead of schedule.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 combo storm deck is to quickly generate mana and draw cards in order to cast a powerful storm spell, usually Ad Nauseam or Tendrils of Agony, to win the game in a single turn. The deck utilizes cards like Lotus Petal, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Dark Ritual to generate mana quickly, along with card draw spells like Brainstorm and Gitaxian Probe to find the necessary combo pieces. Burning Wish is used to tutor for specific storm spells, while Duress and Cabal Therapy help to disrupt opponent's strategies.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 flying indestructible Marit Lage token. It includes cards like Crop Rotation, Expedition Map, and Sylvan Scrying to tutor for the necessary pieces, along with disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to protect the combo. The deck also includes acceleration with cards like Lotus Petal and Elvish Spirit Guide to ensure the combo can be achieved as quickly as possible and win the game in a single turn.

The deck focuses on using Life from the Loam to recur lands from the graveyard, allowing for mana denial with Wasteland and resource advantage with Horizon Canopy. Control elements are achieved through Chalice of the Void, Liliana of the Veil, and Abrupt Decay, while pressure is applied with Knight of the Reliquary and Dark Confidant. The deck aims to grind out the opponent by disrupting their mana base, stripping away resources, and maintaining card advantage through its synergy with Life from the Loam. The deck excels at creating a resource advantage over time and wearing down opponents through attrition.

The main strategy of this UWx Control deck is to interact with the opponent's cards through counterspells, removal, and card manipulation to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By leveraging powerful cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Snapcaster Mage, and Search for Azcanta, the deck aims to draw into its answers while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Counterbalance and Back to Basics also help to lock out certain strategies and gain an advantage in the long game.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana through cards like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond, and then casting a large number of spells in a single turn to build up to a lethal Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam finish. It uses a mix of rituals, cantrips, and discard spells to set up its combo turn while also protecting itself with disruption like Duress and Cabal Therapy. The deck aims to win the game in one explosive turn, drawing through the deck with cards like Brainstorm and Past in Flames to maximize its storm count and finish off the opponent.

The deck focuses on taking control of the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage. By disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Hymn to Tourach and Kolaghan's Command, while also maintaining card advantage with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Dark Confidant, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the board. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor to further control the game, making it difficult for the opponent to establish a strong board presence.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through countermagic, hand disruption, and removal spells, while generating card advantage with efficient creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Baleful Strix. Leovold, Emissary of Trest provides additional disruption and card advantage, while planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope can help control the game and provide additional value. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's multi-colored spells, allowing for flexibility in casting spells and ensuring a strong late-game presence.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base with Wasteland while applying pressure with efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler. The deck also aims to control the game with counterspells like Force of Will and Stifle, as well as card selection with Brainstorm and Ponder. Additionally, the deck utilizes versatile cards like Lightning Bolt and Deathrite Shaman for additional removal and disruption. The combination of disruption, aggression, and card advantage makes this deck a powerful force in the Legacy format.

This deck aims to control the game through a combination of countermagic, removal, and card advantage, while also disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland. The deck utilizes the Standstill enchantment to slow down the game and draw cards while keeping the opponent at bay. It also includes powerful win conditions in the form of planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End. By continuously disrupting the opponent's game plan and generating incremental advantages, this deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver its opponents in the long game.
